It was time.  The females exit the cave and bow their heads to Tucson.  The=
y look into the cave.  The old female nudges Tucson gently with her muzzle,=
 coaxing him to enter the cave.  Yet she reminds the silver and black drago=
n that it wasn't quite his place to enter the cave.  Not when Tucson was ab=
out to meet his offspring for the first time.

" I'm sorry, but rules are r=
ules. You have to wait until they say you can enter the cave.  Now, excuse =
me, I have a child to attend to."

Slowly, with his head down, Tucson enter=
s the cave, as he pads his way over to Talon and smiles to her.  His eyes l=
ight up with joy, as he looks down upon his offspring for the first time.  =


" We did it Talon, we brought a new life into the world. "

Local artist =
who specializes in illustration, using traditional and digital media.  

I =
also specialize in hand made crafts.  Great for any occasion!  

Need a gre=
at gift idea that is original?  No problem!  Email me at this address and w=
e will talk.

ht of the scanning device light up briefly the cave. Talon fell exausted to=
o weak to move. Loud shrieking could be hear from the entrance of the cave

trange black coloration along with his silver as well. He was stiff with ap=
prehension, yet, knew not to rouse this dragon.
> > 
> > "How did you know =
who I am? And who are you? I find that rather strange that you know me, see=
ing that the old dragon had no mention of another, yet alone another who ca=
n converse in my language."
> > 
> > He gets up, and stands rather stiffly.=
 He's swift to shift his weight around, and put himself in front of the mou=
th of the cave.
> > 
> > " I'm sorry, but my child is about to be born and =
I wish no harm to come to it."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Supe=
r Cyclonus <supercyclonus@> wrote:
> > >

ld to be born a winged shape appeared in
> > > the air flying nearly soundl=
essly. It was a silver and black dragon,

ncient Dragon who's form TUCSON had taken,

> > >

s it arrived the other dragons in the area began to back away, not in

 fear but in reverence as they bowed low before him, some of them
> > > mut=
tering the word, "The Disciple' under their breath.
> > >

 turned to look at TUCSON, silver eyes with black pupils,
> > > looking alm=
ost human in its draconic head. "Greetings Tucson." It
> > > said, somehow =
knowing his name.
